00022 /**
00023  * @file   QuantMethodExprChipSummary.cpp
00024  * @author Alan Williams
00025  * 
00026  * @brief Summarize and output basic statistics on the performance of
00027  * a particular summarization or detection method across a number of
00028  * cel files.
00029  */

00031 #include "chipstream/QuantMethodExprChipSummary.h"

00039 /**
00040  * @brief Sort pairs by the first coordinate, or the second
00041  * coordinate if the first coordinates are equal.
00042  */
00043 bool QuantMethodExprChipSummary::CoordSort::operator() (const std::pair<float, float>* p1, 
00044                                                       const std::pair<float, float>* p2) const {
00045   if (fabs ((double)p1->first - (double)p2->first) > DBL_MIN)
00046     return p1->first < p2->first;
00047   else
00048     return p1->second < p2->second;
00049 }

00052 /** 
00053  * Constructor. If both the groupNames are empty then
00054  * all probesets are included in statistics.
00055  */
00056 QuantMethodExprChipSummary::ProbeSetGroupStats::ProbeSetGroupStats(const std::string &name, uint32_t numChips, 
00057                                                                  bool cacheData, bool doThreshold,
00058                                                                  double minThreshold,
00059                                                                  double maxThreshold,
00060                                                                  const std::set<std::string> &groupNames) {
00061   assert(numChips);
00062   m_Name = name;
00063   m_ValidNames = groupNames;
00064   m_DoThreshold = doThreshold;
00065   m_MinThreshold = minThreshold;
00066   m_MaxThreshold = maxThreshold;
00067   m_PsCount = 0;
00068   m_AtomCount = 0;
00069   m_CacheData = cacheData;
00070   m_Summaries.resize(numChips);
00071   m_RLEs.resize(numChips);
00072   m_MADs.resize(numChips);
00073   m_Data.resize(numChips);
00074 }
00075 
00076 /** 
00077  * Check to see if we are including a particular ProbeSetGroup in
00078  * our statistics.
00079  * @param psGroup - ProbeSetGroup to check for inclusion.
00080  * @return bool - true if should be included, false otherwise.
00081  */
00082 bool QuantMethodExprChipSummary::ProbeSetGroupStats::inGroup(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup) {
00083   if(m_ValidNames.empty())
00084     return true;
00085   if(psGroup.name != NULL && m_ValidNames.find(psGroup.name) != m_ValidNames.end())
00086     return true;
00087   return false;
00088 }

00091 /** 
00092  * Given a probeset group, extract and keep track of summary data
00093  * statistics.
00094  *
00095  * @param qMethod - The quantification method to extract statistics from.
00096  */
00097 void QuantMethodExprChipSummary::ProbeSetGroupStats::report(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, QuantExprMethod &qMethod) {
00098   if(inGroup(psGroup)) {
00099     uint32_t chipCount = qMethod.getNumTargets();
00100     std::vector<float> chipEffects;
00101     chipEffects.reserve(chipCount);
00102     
00103     /* Basic count of probes and probesets. */
00104     m_PsCount++;
00105     for(uint32_t i = 0; i < qMethod.getNumFeatures(); i++) {
00106       if(qMethod.featureUsed(i)) 
00107         m_AtomCount++;
00108     }
00109     
00110     /* Chip level statistics. */
00111     for(uint32_t chipIx = 0; chipIx < chipCount; chipIx++) {
00112       /* For present absent calls just do percent. */
00113       if(m_DoThreshold) {
00114         float val = qMethod.getTargetEffect(chipIx);
00115         if(m_CacheData) 
00116           m_Data[chipIx].push_back(val);
00117         if(val >= m_MinThreshold && val <= m_MaxThreshold) {
00118           m_Summaries[chipIx].addData(1);
00119         }
00120         else {
00121           m_Summaries[chipIx].addData(0);
00122         }
00123       }
00124       else {
00125         /* Basic value for each chip. */
00126         float chipVal = qMethod.getTargetEffect(chipIx);
00127         m_Summaries[chipIx].addData(chipVal);
00128         
00129         if(m_CacheData) 
00130           m_Data[chipIx].push_back(chipVal);
00131         
00132         /* Save for later as need to do medians. */
00133         if(qMethod.getScale() != QuantExprMethod::Log2) 
00134           chipVal = log2(chipVal);
00135         
00136         chipEffects.push_back(chipVal);
00137         std::vector<float> absResiduals;
00138         /* Do Median Absolute Deviation (MAD) of residuals if exist. */
00139         if(qMethod.haveResiduals()) {
00140           uint32_t featCount = qMethod.getNumFeatures();
00141           absResiduals.reserve(featCount);
00142           for(uint32_t featIx = 0; featIx < featCount; featIx++) {
00143             if(qMethod.featureUsed(featIx)) {
00144               absResiduals.push_back(fabs(qMethod.getResidual(featIx, chipIx)));
00145             }
00146           }
00147           float residMed = median_in_place(absResiduals.begin(), absResiduals.end());
00148           m_MADs[chipIx].addData(residMed);
00149         }
00150       }
00151     }
00152     if(!m_DoThreshold) {
00153       /* Loop through again to calculate median expression and RLE. */
00154       float chipMed = median(chipEffects.begin(), chipEffects.end());
00155       for(uint32_t chipIx = 0; chipIx < chipCount; chipIx++) {
00156         float RleVal = fabs(chipEffects[chipIx] - chipMed);
00157         m_RLEs[chipIx].addData(RleVal);
00158       }
00159     }
00160   }
00161 }
00162 
00163 /** Constructor. */
00164 QuantMethodExprChipSummary::QuantMethodExprChipSummary(const std::vector<std::string> &chipNames,
00165                                                    bool doThreshold, double minThreshold, double maxThreshold,
00166                                                    std::string qccFile,
00167                                                    vector<MetaProbeset *> &metaSets) {
00168   setValid(false);
00169   std::set<std::string> groupNames;
00170   m_ChipNames = chipNames;
00171   m_posControlIx = -1;
00172   m_negControlIx = -1;
00173   m_DoThreshold = doThreshold;
00174   m_HavePosControls  = false;
00175   m_HaveNegControls = false;
00176 
00177   m_QcPsResults.resize(chipNames.size());
00178 
00179   set<string> psToRun;
00180   for(int i=0; i<metaSets.size(); i++) {
00181       psToRun.insert(ToStr(metaSets[i]->name));
00182   }
00183 
00184   /* Always add a group for all probesets, leaving both sets empty
00185      acts as wildcard. */
00186   addGroupStat("all_probeset", false, groupNames,
00187                doThreshold, minThreshold, maxThreshold,
00188                false, false);
00189 
00190   if(qccFile!="")
00191     readGroupsFile(qccFile, doThreshold, minThreshold, maxThreshold, psToRun);
00192 
00193   // Then AUC
00194   if (m_HavePosControls && m_HaveNegControls) {
00195     declareMetric("pos_vs_neg_auc", ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00196   } 
00197 
00198   // Add qc probeset signal metrics
00199   for(map<string,string>::iterator sIx = m_QuantInHeader.begin(); sIx != m_QuantInHeader.end(); sIx++) {
00200       map<string,string>::iterator gIx = m_QuantInHeaderGroup.find(sIx->first);
00201       set<string>::iterator qcIx = psToRun.find(sIx->first);
00202       if(gIx != m_QuantInHeaderGroup.end() && qcIx != psToRun.end()) {
00203         //Verbose::out(1,"Adding metric '" + gIx->second + "-" + sIx->second + "'");
00204         declareMetric(gIx->second + "-" + sIx->second, ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00205         m_QcPsNameVec.push_back(sIx->first);
00206       }
00207   }
00208 
00209 
00210 }
00211 
00212 /** 
00213  * Load up the groups from a simple tab delimited text file. Need to
00214  * have a column called 'group_name' and then at least one column
00215  * named 'probeset_id' or 'probeset_name'. If groups called
00216  * 'pos_control' and 'neg_control' are both supplied then the AUC
00217  * from the ROC is estimated and reported as well. Looks something
00218  * like:
00219  *
00220  * \verbatim
00221  group_name   probeset_name
00222  pos_control  AFFX-123
00223  pos_control  AFFX-456
00224  neg_control  AFFX-789
00225  \endverbatim
00226  * @param fileName - path to text file to read from.
00227  * @param doThreshold - Should we be doing thresholding (detection based)?
00228  * @param minThreshold - Minimum value to pass threshold.
00229  * @param maxThreshold - Maximum value to pass threshold.
00230  */
00231 void QuantMethodExprChipSummary::readGroupsFile(const std::string &fileName, bool doThreshold, 
00232                                               double minThreshold, double maxThreshold,
00233                                               std::set<std::string> &psToRun) {
00234   TsvFile tsv;
00235   map<string, set<string> > groupSets;
00236   map<string, set<string> >::iterator mapIx;
00237   string groupName;
00238   int psIdInt = -1;
00239   int quantInHeader = 0;
00240   string psIdString;
00241   tsv.bind(0, "group_name", &groupName, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00242   tsv.bind(0, "probeset_name", &psIdString, TSV_BIND_OPTIONAL);
00243   tsv.bind(0, "probeset_id", &psIdInt, TSV_BIND_OPTIONAL);
00244   tsv.bind(0, "quantification_in_header", &quantInHeader, TSV_BIND_OPTIONAL);
00245   if(tsv.open(fileName) != TSV_OK) 
00246     Err::errAbort("QuantMethodExprChipSummary::readGroupsFile() - Can't open file '" + fileName + "' to read.");
00247   if(tsv.cname2cidx(0, "probeset_name") < 0 && tsv.cname2cidx(0, "probeset_id") < 0) 
00248     Err::errAbort("QuantMethodExprChipSummary::readGroupsFile() - Must have either 'probeset_name' or 'probeset_id' column");
00249   while(tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00250 
00251     string psName;
00252     if(psIdInt >= 0) 
00253       psName = ToStr(psIdInt);
00254     else if(psIdString != "") 
00255       psName = psIdString;
00256     else
00257       Err::errAbort("Must have valid probeset_id or probeset_name");
00258 
00259     // Skip if we are not going to process this probeset
00260     set<string>::iterator qcIx = psToRun.find(psName);
00261     if(qcIx == psToRun.end())
00262         continue;
00263 
00264     mapIx = groupSets.find(groupName);
00265 
00266     /* Check to see if this is a new group. */
00267     if(mapIx == groupSets.end()) {
00268       set<string> newSet;
00269       newSet.insert(psName);
00270       groupSets[groupName] = newSet;
00271     }
00272     else {
00273       /* Already a group, just add info to the sets. */
00274       mapIx->second.insert(psName);
00275     }
00276 
00277     /* Check to see if we keep the probeset info around */
00278     if(quantInHeader == 1) {
00279       if(psIdString != "")
00280         m_QuantInHeader[psName] = psIdString;
00281       else
00282         m_QuantInHeader[psName] = psName;
00283       m_QuantInHeaderGroup[psName] = groupName;
00284     }
00285   }
00286   tsv.close();
00287 
00288   for (mapIx = groupSets.begin(); mapIx != groupSets.end(); ++mapIx) {
00289     bool isPosControl = false, isNegControl = false, cacheData = false;
00290     if(mapIx->first == "pos_control") {
00291       isPosControl = true;
00292       cacheData = true;
00293       m_HavePosControls = true;
00294     }
00295     else if(mapIx->first == "neg_control") {
00296       isNegControl = true;
00297       cacheData = true;
00298       m_HaveNegControls = true;
00299     }
00300     addGroupStat(mapIx->first, cacheData, mapIx->second,
00301                  doThreshold, minThreshold, maxThreshold, isPosControl, isNegControl);
00302   }
00303 }
00304 
00305 /** 
00306  * Add a group that we wish to keep statistics for. If a probeset's name is in
00307  * the name set the results for that probeset will be added to the summary
00308  * stats. If both the name set is empty it acts as a wildcard and
00309  * statistics are kept for every probeset.
00310  * 
00311  * @param name - Reference name for this group.
00312  * @param cacheData - Should we keep the data in RAM as we go? (i.e. for ROC curve).
00313  * @param names - Set containing names of probesets to be kept.
00314  * @param doThreshold - Should we be doing thresholding (detection based)?
00315  * @param minThreshold - Minimum value to pass threshold.
00316  * @param maxThreshold - Maximum value to pass threshold.
00317  * @param isPosControl - Should this group of stats be considered a positive control
00318  * @param isNegControl - Should this group of stats be considered a negative control
00319  */
00320 void QuantMethodExprChipSummary::addGroupStat(const std::string &name, 
00321                                             bool cacheData,
00322                                             const std::set<std::string> &names,
00323                                             bool doThreshold, double minThresh, double maxThresh,
00324                                             bool isPosControl, bool isNegControl) {
00325 
00326   if(isPosControl && isNegControl) 
00327     Err::errAbort("QuantMethodExprChipSummary::addGroupStat() - Can't have both neg and pos control be true");
00328   else if(isPosControl) {
00329     m_posControlIx = m_Stats.size();
00330     cacheData = true;
00331   }
00332   else if(isNegControl) {
00333     m_negControlIx = m_Stats.size();
00334     cacheData = true;
00335   }
00336   m_Stats.push_back(ProbeSetGroupStats(name, m_ChipNames.size(), 
00337                                        cacheData, doThreshold, minThresh, maxThresh, names));
00338 
00339   declareMetric(name + "_probesets", ChipSummary::Metric::Integer);
00340   declareMetric(name + "_atoms", ChipSummary::Metric::Integer);
00341 
00342   if(doThreshold) {
00343     declareMetric(name + "_percent_called", ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00344   } else {
00345     declareMetric(name + "_mean", ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00346     declareMetric(name + "_stdev", ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00347     declareMetric(name + "_mad_residual_mean", ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00348     declareMetric(name + "_mad_residual_stdev", ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00349     declareMetric(name + "_rle_mean", ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00350     declareMetric(name + "_rle_stdev", ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00351   }
00352 }
00353 
00354 bool QuantMethodExprChipSummary::prepare(QuantMethod &qMethod, const IntensityMart &iMart) {
00355     for(int i=0; i<iMart.getCelFileCount(); i++) {
00356         std::vector<ChipSummary::Metric> metrics;
00357         m_SummaryStats.push_back(metrics);
00358     }
00359     return true;
00360 }
00361 
00362 /** 
00363  * After every probeset computation this function is called an is an opportunity
00364  * to query the quantification method for results, residuals, etc.
00365  * @param psGroup - List of probesets from which probes were used.
00366  * @param qMethod - Quantification method with compute method called.
00367  * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00368  */  
00369 bool QuantMethodExprChipSummary::report(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, QuantMethod &qMethod,
00370                                       const IntensityMart &iMart, std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, 
00371                                       PmAdjuster &pmAdjust) {
00372   QuantExprMethod *qeMethod = dynamic_cast<QuantExprMethod *>(&qMethod);
00373   if(qeMethod == NULL) {
00374     Err::errAbort("Can't call QuantMethodExprChipSummary::report() with something other than a QuantExprMethod.");
00375   }
00376   std::vector<ProbeSetGroupStats>::iterator statIx;
00377   for(statIx = m_Stats.begin(); statIx != m_Stats.end(); ++statIx) {
00378     statIx->report(psGroup, *qeMethod);
00379   }
00380 
00381   // deal with m_QuantInHeader
00382   map<string, string>::iterator sIx;
00383   sIx = m_QuantInHeader.find(psGroup.name);
00384   if(sIx != m_QuantInHeader.end()) {
00385     m_QcPsSeen.push_back(sIx->first);
00386     for(int chip=0; chip<qeMethod->getNumTargets(); chip++) {
00387         m_QcPsResults[chip].push_back(qeMethod->getSignalEstimate(chip));
00388     }
00389   }
00390 
00391   return true;
00392 }
00393 
00394 bool QuantMethodExprChipSummary::finish(QuantMethod &qMethod) {
00395 
00396     // Order of metrics:
00397     // - per catagory metrics
00398     // - pos vs neg auc
00399     // - various probeset signals for qc probesets
00400 
00401     // Load up other metrics computed in m_Stats
00402     for(int chip = 0; chip < m_SummaryStats.size(); chip++) {
00403         std::vector<ProbeSetGroupStats>::iterator statIx;
00404         for(statIx = m_Stats.begin(); statIx != m_Stats.end(); ++statIx) {
00405             m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric(statIx->m_Name + "_probesets", (int)statIx->m_PsCount));
00406             m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric(statIx->m_Name + "_atoms", (int)statIx->m_AtomCount));
00407             if(statIx->m_PsCount == 0) {
00408                 // Dummy values because we failed to compute the expected probesets
00409                 if(statIx->m_DoThreshold) {
00410                     m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric(statIx->m_Name + "_percent_called", -1.0));
00411                 } else {
00412                     m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric(statIx->m_Name + "_mean", -1.0));
00413                     m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric(statIx->m_Name + "_stdev", -1.0));
00414                     m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric(statIx->m_Name + "_mad_residual_mean", -1.0));
00415                     m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric(statIx->m_Name + "_mad_residual_stdev", -1.0));
00416                     m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric(statIx->m_Name + "_rle_mean", -1.0));
00417                     m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric(statIx->m_Name + "_rle_stdev", -1.0));
00418                 }
00419             } else {
00420                 if(statIx->m_DoThreshold) {
00421                     m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric(statIx->m_Name + "_percent_called", 
00422                                                 statIx->m_Summaries[chip].getMean()));
00423                 } else {
00424                     m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric(statIx->m_Name + "_mean", 
00425                                                 statIx->m_Summaries[chip].getMean()));
00426                     m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric(statIx->m_Name + "_stdev", 
00427                                                 statIx->m_Summaries[chip].getStdev()));
00428                     m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric(statIx->m_Name + "_mad_residual_mean", 
00429                                                 statIx->m_MADs[chip].getMean()));
00430                     m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric(statIx->m_Name + "_mad_residual_stdev", 
00431                                                 statIx->m_MADs[chip].getStdev()));
00432                     m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric(statIx->m_Name + "_rle_mean", 
00433                                                 statIx->m_RLEs[chip].getMean()));
00434                     m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric(statIx->m_Name + "_rle_stdev", 
00435                                                 statIx->m_RLEs[chip].getStdev()));
00436                 }
00437             }
00438         }
00439     }
00440 
00441     // Compute AUC
00442     if(m_HavePosControls && m_HaveNegControls) {
00443         if(m_negControlIx >= 0 && m_posControlIx >= 0) {
00444             for(int chip=0; chip<m_SummaryStats.size(); chip++) {
00445                 m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric("pos_vs_neg_auc",
00446                     calcAuc(m_Stats[m_posControlIx].m_Data[chip], m_Stats[m_negControlIx].m_Data[chip], m_DoThreshold)));
00447             }
00448         } else {
00449             // Dummy values because we failed to compute the expected probesets
00450             for(int chip=0; chip<m_SummaryStats.size(); chip++) {
00451                 m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric("pos_vs_neg_auc",-1.0f));
00452             }
00453         }
00454     }
00455 
00456     // Add qc probeset signal metrics
00457     for(int qcPsIdx=0; qcPsIdx<m_QcPsNameVec.size(); qcPsIdx++) {
00458         // Do we have results for this probeset?
00459         int seenIdx = 0;
00460         bool found = false;
00461         for(seenIdx = 0; seenIdx < m_QcPsSeen.size(); seenIdx++) {
00462             if(m_QcPsSeen[seenIdx] == m_QcPsNameVec[qcPsIdx]) {
00463                 found = true;
00464                 break;
00465             }
00466         }
00467 
00468         for(int chip=0; chip<m_SummaryStats.size(); chip++) {
00469             std::string name = m_QuantInHeaderGroup[m_QcPsNameVec[qcPsIdx]] + "-" + 
00470                                     m_QuantInHeader[m_QcPsNameVec[qcPsIdx]];
00471             if(found) {
00472                 m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric(name, m_QcPsResults[chip][seenIdx]));
00473             } else {
00474                 m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric(name, -1.0));
00475             }
00476         }
00477     }
00478 
00479     setValid(true);
00480 
00481     return true;
00482 }
00483 
00484 /** 
00485  * Calculate the area under the ROC curve generated by the scores
00486  * for the positive and negative vectors. This code comes directly from
00487  * Peter's translation of the original exact perl code
00488  * @param pos - Vector of scores for positive examples.
00489  * @param neg - Vector of scores for negative examples.
00490  * @return - Estimate of area under the ROC curve.
00491  */
00492 double QuantMethodExprChipSummary::calcAuc(std::vector<float> &posOrig, std::vector<float> &negOrig, bool increasing) {
00493   vector<float> pos(posOrig), neg(negOrig);
00494   if(!increasing) {
00495     vector<float>::iterator posIx, negIx;
00496     for(posIx = pos.begin(); posIx != pos.end(); ++posIx) {
00497       *posIx = -1 * (*posIx);
00498     }
00499     for(negIx = neg.begin(); negIx != neg.end(); ++negIx) {
00500       *negIx = -1 * (*negIx);
00501     }
00502   }
00503   sort (pos.begin(), pos.end());
00504   sort (neg.begin(), neg.end());
00505   vector<float> all (pos);
00506   all.insert (all.end(), neg.begin(), neg.end());
00507   sort (all.begin(), all.end());
00508 
00509   // Fun with C++: roc (x,y) coordinates are a set, sorted by first coordinate,
00510   // the second coordinate if the first are equal.
00511   typedef set<pair<float, float>*, CoordSort> coordSet;
00512   coordSet roc;
00513   // looks like the set will sometimes drop items that need to be deleted, keep track here
00514   vector<pair<float, float> *> toFree; 
00515   pair<float, float>* lowerLeft = new pair<float, float>;
00516   lowerLeft->first = lowerLeft->second = 0;
00517   roc.insert (lowerLeft);
00518   toFree.push_back(lowerLeft);
00519   pair<float, float>* upperRight = new pair<float, float>;
00520   upperRight->first = upperRight->second = 1;
00521   roc.insert (upperRight);
00522   toFree.push_back(upperRight);
00523   const unsigned int posSize = pos.size();
00524   const unsigned int negSize = neg.size();
00525   const float posSizeDbl = (float)posSize;
00526   const float negSizeDbl = (float)negSize;
00527   const unsigned int allSize = all.size();
00528   
00529   unsigned int pI = 0;
00530   unsigned int nI = 0;
00531   for(unsigned int j = 0; j < allSize; ++j) {
00532     for(unsigned int k = pI; k < posSize; ++k) {
00533       if (pos[k] <= all[j])
00534         pI = k;
00535       else
00536         break;
00537     }
00538     for(unsigned int k = nI; k < negSize; ++k) {
00539       if(neg[k] <= all[j])
00540         nI = k;
00541       else
00542         break;
00543     }
00544     pair<float, float>* point = new pair<float, float>;
00545     point->first = (float)(nI + 1) / negSizeDbl;
00546     point->second = (float)(pI + 1) / posSizeDbl;
00547     roc.insert (point);
00548     toFree.push_back(point);
00549   }
00550   
00551   double auc = 0;
00552   const coordSet::const_iterator rocEnd = roc.end();
00553   for(coordSet::const_iterator iter = roc.begin(); ; ++iter) {
00554     coordSet::const_iterator next = iter;
00555     // Process to the next to last entry.
00556     if(++next == rocEnd)
00557       break;
00558     const double w = (*next)->first - (*iter)->first;
00559     const double h1 = min ((*iter)->second, (*next)->second);
00560     const double h2 = max ((*iter)->second, (*next)->second);
00561     auc += w * h1 + 0.5 * w * (h2 - h1);
00562   }
00563   // Clean up.
00564   vector<pair<float, float> *>::iterator iter;
00565   for(iter = toFree.begin(); iter != toFree.end(); ++iter) {
00566     delete *iter;
00567   }
00568   return auc;
00569 }
Generated on Tue Jul 15 2014 10:37:36 for Affymetrix Power Tools by  1.7.1
